posts.post_content:
Would be great if shroud hadn't been so weakened in constructed by all the "target player" creature destruction. As is, sideboard at best.  
  
Seems to combo well with [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm) and [Slagstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagstorm) to clear the board but leave the turtles alive.

posts.post_content:
I found something super nifty about shroud, and since I like turtles, Imma share it here with you guys instead of on something better, like Neurok Commando. Please don't pass it around, thanks.  
  
Soulbond bypasses Shroud! Turn your Calcite Snapper into a 6/3 with Druid's Familiar, or let that four damage net you a card with dear old Tandem Lookout. Opponent's board position got your down? give Calcite flying with Wingcrafter! Or first strike or haste (lol why) or lifelink!

posts.post_content: @Tommy9898: Well, [Turtleshell Changeling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turtleshell Changeling) costs 1 more, meaning that it can attack for 4 power on turn 5 if you pay ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). Also, because this costs no mana, it allows you to use that mana later. The 3 cmc allows it to attack turn 4 for 4, which is very rare in blue, especially on a common. The landfall is especially good in this block, because of all the fetchlands and such. Lastly, the shroud means that your opponent can't use removal on it, and 4 toughness, especially in the early game, can reliably block a lot of stuff.

posts.post_content:
This guy is seriously awesome. He holds down the fort so well, bouncing spells and and blades off his shell, and when nothing's on the board, he just lashes out and bites for four every turn, and they can't do anything about it!  
  
I love the flavor, I love the picture, and I love the anguish this causes opponents. In the pre-release, I kept attacking with double snappers for the win.   
  
Frustrated, my opponent cried, "I CAN'T LOSE TO TURTLES!"   
  
5/5

Posted By: Lueseto (11/17/2012 10:28:30 AM)

posts.post_content:
Why do people just assume shroud = "immune to all magic"?  
  
@ stille\_nacht  
  
Shroud doesnt mean it can't be countered....unless the card ***specifically*** says it cannot be countered (like [Thrun, the Last Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrun, the Last Troll)), or you already have an permanent on the board saying spells you cast can't be countered, they can still counter your spell while its resolving.  
  
@ DacenOctavio  
  
Your commando will die. Pyroclasm and Slagstorm WILL hit creatures with shroud, as they do not ***target*** specific creatures. Shroud only prevents targeting.
posts.html:
Why do people just assume shroud = "immune to all magic"?

@ stille_nacht

Shroud doesnt mean it can't be countered....unless the card specifically says it cannot be countered (like Thrun, the Last Troll), or you already have an permanent on the board saying spells you cast can't be countered, they can still counter your spell while its resolving.

@ DacenOctavio

Your commando will die. Pyroclasm and Slagstorm WILL hit creatures with shroud, as they do not target specific creatures. Shroud only prevents targeting.
